intro: Leandra balansae, commonly known as the Balansae tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
